perturbation.original_text: Company agrees that no use of the name of the NFLA Identification nor any item used in connection with the name of NFLA Identification (including any Licensed Product) will be made under this Agreement unless and until the same is approved by the NFLA. The NFLA agrees that any material, advertising or otherwise, submitted for approval as provided in this section may be deemed by Company to have been approved under this section if the same is not disapproved in writing within ten (10) business days after receipt of the material.
perturbation.changed_text: Company agrees that no use of the name of the NFLA Identification nor any item used in connection with the name of NFLA Identification (including any Licensed Product) will be made under this Agreement unless and until the same is approved by the NFLA. The NFLA agrees that any material, advertising or otherwise, submitted for approval as provided in this section may be deemed by Company to have been approved under this section if the same is not disapproved in writing within two (2) business days after receipt of the material.
perturbation.explanation: The modification shortens the approval period for advertising material from ten business days to two business days. This creates a legal contradiction because, depending on the specific type of advertising and the claims made, applicable advertising regulations (e.g., those enforced by the FTC) may require a longer period for legal review to ensure compliance and avoid misleading claims. This timeframe is unreasonably short.
perturbation.contradicted_law: Federal Trade Commission (FTC) advertising regulations; California Consumer Protection Laws

perturbation.original_text:
All payments shall be made by wire transfer drawn to the account of NFLA-NC no later than ten (10) business days after the end of each quarter as follows:

$0.05 per Unit as described herein of Company’s Products sold in the Contract Territory payable to NFLA-NC. Donated amounts will be allocated and dispersed to the NFLA-NC beginning on the first full quarter (three month period) of the Agreement and continue on a quarterly basis thereafter for the term of this Agreement.
perturbation.changed_text:
All payments shall be made by wire transfer drawn to the account of NFLA-NC no later than forty-five (45) business days after the end of each quarter as follows:

$0.05 per Unit as described herein of Company’s Products sold in the Contract Territory payable to NFLA-NC. Donated amounts will be allocated and dispersed to the NFLA-NC beginning on the first full quarter (three month period) of the Agreement and continue on a quarterly basis thereafter for the term of this Agreement.
perturbation.explanation: The modification extends the payment period from ten business days to forty-five business days after the end of each quarter. This creates a legal contradiction if such a delay violates California's prompt payment laws, which may require payments to be made within a significantly shorter timeframe, especially for charitable contributions tied to sales revenue. Unreasonable delays in payments to charitable organizations may also be considered a breach of fiduciary duty or raise concerns about the company's financial practices.
perturbation.contradicted_law: California's prompt payment laws for commercial transactions; potential breach of fiduciary duty standards.

perturbation.original_text: Company may liquidate and sell its inventory of Licensed Products (including any inventory then in production) for a period of ninety (90) days after the termination date of the Contract Period, subject to the Company’s continued obligation to pay the Fee as provided above, and will deliver the Sales Report with respect to such liquidation sales within 30 days following the end of the first reached full quarter following termination.
perturbation.changed_text: Company may liquidate and sell its inventory of Licensed Products (including any inventory then in production) for a period of fifteen (15) days after the termination date of the Contract Period, subject to the Company’s continued obligation to pay the Fee as provided above, and will deliver the Sales Report with respect to such liquidation sales within 60 days following the end of the first reached full quarter following termination.
perturbation.explanation: The modification shortens the liquidation period from ninety days to fifteen days and extends the sales report delivery to sixty days. This creates a legal contradiction because California's Commercial Code regarding the sale of goods may imply a reasonable time for liquidation that is longer than 15 days, especially considering the potential volume of inventory and the need to maximize sales proceeds. Also, the sales report should be before the liquidation not after.
perturbation.contradicted_law: California Commercial Code regarding reasonable time for liquidation of goods after contract termination.
